entries.meaning: (phonology) A sound change in which [b] (the voiced bilabial plosive) shifts to [v] (the voiced labiodental fricative).
examples: Betacism is a fairly common phenomenon: it has taken place in Greek, Hebrew, Spanish, and some Portuguese dialects, among others.

entries.meaning: A speech disorder involving excessive use of the [b] sound, or conversion of other sounds into it.
